series_title: This schedule replaces 602-013 dated February 1, 2003. Administrative Management Records
series_description: This series documents reference and management reports.
retention_statement: Retain for 5 years or until records lose their administrative value, whichever is longer, then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page.

series_description: This series documents the annual physical inventory of all DMAS computers and systems.
retention_statement: Retain for one year or until next inventory, whichever is longer then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page.

series_description: This series documents the packaging inventory for the computer hardware.
retention_statement: Retain for 5 years or until hardware is replaced, whichever is longer, then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page.

series_description: This series documents the software inventory currently supported by DMAS IT support personnel. Includes licensing agreements and requirements.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer used or supported by DMAS IT staff, then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page.

series_description: This series documents all system participants for access to Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) and DMAS local area network. Includes individual and supervisory access and authorization documents.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 years after separation then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on schedule cover page.

series_title: Information Services Requests and Project Records
series_description: This series documents all IT service requests, including data processing system development for DMAS employees and contractors. Also documents on-going and single use IT projects including ad hoc programs designed to meet individual user needs.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after system is approved/rejected and audited then transfer to the State Records Center. Retain in State Records Center 8 years then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page. Total retention 10 years.

series_title: Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) – Project Testing and Development Records
series_description: This series documents the design needs, functionality requirements, and testing activities between the MMIS vendor and the DMAS development committee to develop the new Medicaid Management Information System. Includes system, diagnostic and testing criteria to standardize MMIS actions.
retention_statement: Retain until all electronic records created using the programs have been destroyed or converted to another program or format, then delete or destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page.

series_title: Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) – Administrative Project Documentation Records
series_description: This series consists of administrative records, arranged by category and deliverables, pertaining to the development and implementation of the new Medicaid Management Information System. This series includes, but is not limited to: correspondence, production timetables, and receipt of
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after system is approved/rejected and audited then transfer to the State Records Center. Retain in State Records Center 8 years then destroy in compliance with No. 8 on the schedule cover page. Total retention 10 years.
